snippet: A former soldier charged with conspiring to kill a federal agent and a federal informer had gotten out of his handcuffs on his own, a federal prosecutor said.
abstract: Federal prosecutor says that Joseph Hunter, former Army sergeant accused of being contract killer charged with conspiring to kill federal agent and informant in Liberia, is being kept separately in the Metropolitan Correctional Center; officials say decision was made because he once escaped from handcuffs and is security risk.
lead_paragraph: A former soldier charged with conspiring to kill a federal agent and a federal informer had gotten out of his handcuffs on his own, a federal prosecutor said.

headline.main: To ‘Rambo’ Hit-Man Case, Add an Element of Houdini
headline.print_headline: To ‘Rambo’ Hit-Man Case, Add an Element of Houdini
